header.title: SSH

section.title: Introduction
section.p: The Secure Shell (SSH) is a transport protocol. For more detailed information, see the following RFCs:
The SSH application is an implementation of the SSH protocol in Erlang. Conceptually it can be partitioned into four layers:

list.item: Subsystem - user-named services such as ssh_sftp. The user can also add other subsystems (e.g. NETCONF).
Exec - one-time remote execution (i.e. SCP). See ssh_connection:exec/4

section.title: Configuration and Start
section.p: Before the SSH application can be used, there are two things that must be fulfilled:

list.item: The Crypto application is started before SSH is.
The Public_key application is loaded when running an embedded system.

section.title: Server Side
section.p: When SSH is supposed to run as server, the function ssh:daemon/[1, 2, 3] needs to be used to start the daemon.
